newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkish shares little changed in narrow trade.
newsitem.headline: Turkish shares little changed in narrow trade.

text.p: Istanbul shares ended barely changed on Friday, digesting the recent sharp gains in narrow trade, brokers said.

The IMKB-100 closed at 71,576.67, up 43.21 points or 0.06 percent from Thursday when it eased 0.72 percent after a 3.7 percent jump in the first three days of the week. Over the week, it gained three percent after surging 7.3 percent last week.
Trade volume dived to 8.4 trillion lira ($91.9 million) from Thursday's 18.95 trillion lira ($207.7 million), which included a 5.82 trillion lira ($63.8 million) block deal.

"A down correction has started, with support awaited at 71,000 and then at 70,500. The index is likely to resume its uptrend towards 74,000 after drifting sideways for a few days," said Dilek Akdemir from Yatirim Finansman.
A medium-term uptrend had begun last week amid fresh cash entry and economic optimism, followed by the shattering of critical resistance at 70,000 on Monday.
